messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The test `['org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringBuilderTest.testReflectionLongArrayArray()']` failed.
The test looks like:

```java
237 :     public void testReflectionLongArrayArray() {
238 :         long[][] array = new long[][] { { 1, 2 }, null, { 5 } };
239 :         String baseStr = this.toBaseString(array);
241 :         array = null;
243 :         this.validateNullToStringStyleRegistry(); // error occurred here
244 :     }
```

The passing test with the highest token similarity to the failing test looks like:

 ```None
```

 Functions covered by passing tests are less likely to be buggy.
It failed with the following error message and call stack:

```
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Expected: <null> but was: {}
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringBuilderTest.validateNullToStringStyleRegistry(ToStringBuilderTest.java:586)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringBuilderTest.testReflectionLongArrayArray(ToStringBuilderTest.java:243)
```

Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_classes` function.

The failing test `ToStringBuilderTest.testReflectionLongArrayArray()` is in the `ToStringBuilder` class from the package `org.apache.commons.lang3.builder`. The test appears to be related to `ToStringBuilder` functionality. Let's proceed by checking the methods covered by failing tests in the `ToStringBuilder` class. Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class` function with the class name.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".reflectionToString(java.lang.Object)", ".getStyle()", ".ToStringBuilder(java.lang.Object, org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle, java.lang.StringBuffer)", ".getDefaultStyle()", ".toString()", ".getStringBuffer()", ".getObject()", ".reflectionToString(java.lang.Object, org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle)", ".reflectionToString(java.lang.Object, org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle, boolean)", ".reflectionToString(T, org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle, boolean, java.lang.Class<? super T>)", ".append(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)", ".append(java.lang.Object)", ".ToStringBuilder(java.lang.Object)"]

The failing tests cover several methods in the `ToStringBuilder` class. Now let's retrieve the code snippet for the method `reflectionToString(java.lang.Object)` to understand its implementation. Let's call the `get_code_snippet` function with the method signature.

messages.name: get_code_snippet
messages.content: "154 :     public static String reflectionToString(Object object) {\n155 :         return ReflectionToStringBuilder.toString(object);\n156 :     }"

The `reflectionToString(Object object)` method in the `ToStringBuilder` class simply delegates to `ReflectionToStringBuilder.toString(object)`. This method appears to be a simple forwarding method. Let's continue investigating by retrieving the code snippet for the method `ReflectionToStringBuilder.toString(object)` to see its implementation. Please call the `get_code_snippet` function with the method signature.

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).
